This game is amazing and i think everyone should play it. The level design is fantastic, the sounds are great.
The voice acting is unlike any other. The story is great too. I've completed portal 1 many times but portal 2 is definitely so much better. i think you need to play portal 1 first though. The game just makes more sense if you do. The only bug I've had with it is that the gun is completely gone after the big drop. so i can't see the potato or anything like that which is disappointing but this game is definitely worth a buy.

Tamamen kapalı mekanda geçmesine ve oyunda sadece 3 karakter olmasına rağmen oynarken oyuncuyu sıkmıyor. Üzerinde düşünülmüş diyaloglar, güzel bulmacalar var. Günümüzde çıkan oyunların çeyreği kadar bütçe harcamadan yapılan bu oyun aslında iyi bir oyun için yüksek maliyet gerekmediğini gösteriyor.

Игра очень интересная .Я прохожу её уже 11 раз , 11 раз карл. Если надоест то можно проходить пользовательские уровни или создавать свои. Так же можно пробовать искать баги или пытаться быстро проходить
ну кароче пздц минус вистигулярный аппарат 10 раз стошнило но все таки прошел. Отличное средство от тошноты.

I was really glad I chose to play through this game, and enjoyed making my way through each of the puzzling rooms, some of which left me stumped for upwards of thirty minutes before I finally made some great realisation. I loved the intricacy of many of the rooms and the cleverness of many of the solutions.

The only part of the game I remember not greatly enjoying was the climb out of... Cave Johnson? The ways I went about climbing left me feeling like I was cheating in some strange way, and the messy, ruined look of the environment seemed strangely un-portal-like -- especially when placed in contrast with the spartan, simple structure of each of the test chambers.

A fun game and highly recommended. 
Though I'd play the first game first.

First Played this game Back in 2013, and I always have a blast revisiting it wether it be Singleplayer or Co-Op. It's so Good I'd put it in My top 10 Games of the 2010's!

Slightly bloated and feature heavy? yes. The perfect game? Also yes. Wheatly is a fantastic addition to the cast and the whole backstory is actually pretty heartfelt. The ending is sensational, and the beginning is excellent. It does drag a little when you're doing all that stuff with the liquids etc. in the basement though. I just wanted to get on with it. Cortana is a true hero as your potato sidekick btw.

On top of the main story, Valve just couldn't help themselves and included an entirely extra two player game as well, with its own storyline and honestly much, much more difficult puzzles than you'll see in the single player. This is where you realize that the entirety of the human race, including yourself, is a fallen, broken dumpster fire full of dead babies that can't help but repeatedly murder their so-called friends and teammates through innumerable dickish but ever increasingly creative methods. V. fun and good times. I'm afraid to boot up this game ever because either Camaren or my sister will definitely message me on steam and ask if I want to play 2 player.

Also as I mentioned in my PORTAL 1 REVIEW with this game Gaben stepped up and actually made a UI instead of leaving it as the default shitty Source debugging screen, and it is actually gorgeous. Every unfounded complaint I have ever had about the source engine is null and void with this game. There is no jank, and there was enough elbow grease put into this game and its engine to make me think they found Santa's workshop and sacrificed all his elves to do it.

Thank you, lord GabeN, for this final farewell to an era of Valve making things instead of just tilling the fertile soil of Steam.

Recommended for any liberal pothead hippies who believe the human race is basically good. That'll show them.
